DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to identify a medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery.  Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for patial orientation in total knee replacement._Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery.  Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for patial orientation in total knee replacement.

Concepts.definition: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery. Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for spatial orientation in total knee replacement.

Property.preferredDefinition: Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: After surgery.: An element with atomic symbol Au, atomic number 79, and atomic weight 197.: A radioactive isotope of iridium. Iridium-192 emits gamma rays and has a half-life of 74 days. A high dose rate of this radioisotope can be used in brachytherapy to treat tumors by selectively delivering a cytotoxic dose of radiation to the tumor site.: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery. Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for spatial orientation in total knee replacement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
An element with atomic symbol Au, atomic number 79, and atomic weight 197.

A radioactive isotope of iridium. Iridium-192 emits gamma rays and has a half-life of 74 days. A high dose rate of this radioisotope can be used in brachytherapy to treat tumors by selectively delivering a cytotoxic dose of radiation to the tumor site.

A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery. Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for spatial orientation in total knee replacement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.: Capable of being taken up or taken in.: A medical device placed on or inserted in an anatomic site for accurate visualization of a particular area, prior to radiation treatment or surgery. Examples include markers inserted in the prostate gland for visualization of the site affected by cancer, prior to radiation therapy; markers taped to the scalp prior to imaging in frameless stereotactic brain surgery; and femoral and tibial pins used for spatial orientation in total knee replacement.

Concepts.definition: Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.
Capable of being taken up or taken in.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
